column4: why i get "mount: the special device /dev/disk/by-uuid/fb9d5a70-a92d-428a-a44f-e80de77b1bb1 non exist"?
the special device presumably doesn't exist.
and i read the UUID with vol_id
there's some questions here. First, how did you make the special device?
second, how did you set permissions on it?
third, *why* did you make it? These things typically pop into existence when needed
and for good measure, what're you trying to do? ;)

ok... i'm going to set my new HD with fstab.. i cut it in two part with gparted. so i have /dev/sdb1 and sdb2. after i've read the vol_id in ordet to put the uuid in fstab. at the moment sdb1 work, but sbd2 no.
this is the sdb2 in fstab: UUID=fb9d5a70-a92d-428a-a44f-e80de77b1bb1 /media/sdb2  ext3  defaults  0  0
why aren't you letting gnome take care of mounting it for you?>
Ah, sorry. Reading further back. I see.
i'm going to try to re format this device..
why are you mounting by UUID? I'm lost there.
i wont that at each logon ubuntu auto mount my device!
i want that at each logon ubuntu auto mount my device!
